Rule.Name: PortConnection
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] doesn't have a load.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Connect or remove the port.

Rule.Name: NSidePortAssignmentCheck
Rule.Description: The n-side port [{PORT_NAME}] assignment is not supported.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use p-side port to make assignment.

Rule.Name: PortDifferentialPSideExistence
Rule.ShortDes: Differential port positive side existence check
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] doesn't have a complementary positive side port defined.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Check port definition.

Rule.Name: PortVrefSupport
Rule.Description: The Port [{PORT_NAME}] is set to [{IO_TYPE}], which does not require Vref.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change IOBUF setting to enable VREF.

Rule.Name: PortExistence
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] doesn't exist in the design.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Remove the port.

Rule.Name: PortGroupExistence
Rule.Description: The port group [{GROUP_NAME}] is not defined.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Remove the port group.

Rule.Name: PortGroupUniqueness
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME...}] defined in [{Group}] has been included in multiple port groups.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change group definitions and make sure the port is only included in one port group.

Rule.Name: PortTotalNumber
Rule.Description: The total number of ports [{NUMBER}] exceeds the total assignable pins available [{NUMBER}] in the target device [{ARCH_NAME}-{PKG_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change to a device with more availabe pins.

Rule.Name: PortTotalDifferentialPairNumber
Rule.Description: The total number of {true-LVDS/differential} ports [{NUMBER}] exceeds the total {true-LVDS/differential} pin pairs available [{NUMBER}] in the target device [{ARCH_NAME}-{PKG_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change to a device with more differential pin pairs. Migrate to a large device with more differential pin pairs.

Rule.Name: PortGlobalClkNumber
Rule.Description: The number of clocks [{NUMBER}] exceeds the available number of global clock dedicated pins [{NUMBER}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Warning:non-clock dedicated pins will be used for some clock ports.

Rule.Name: PortTotalIoTypeNumber
Rule.Description: The number of incompatible IO Types defined [{NUMBER}] exceeds the avaiable number of banks/VCCIO values available [{NUMBER}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reduce number of IO Types. Use compatible IO types. Change to a large device with more banks.

Rule.Name: PortFloatingNumber
Rule.Description: The number of unassigned ports [{NUMBER}] exceeds the number of available pins [{NUMBER}] left based on the current assignment.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Rearrange pin assignments. Change to a large device with more pins.

Rule.Name: PortDifferentialIoType
Rule.Description: Single-Ended IO type [{IO_TYPE}] is assigned to the differential port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use a true-LVDS IO type for the port connected with differential primitives.

Rule.Name: PortSingleEndedIoType
Rule.ShortDes: Single ended port IO Type check
Rule.Description: Differential IO type [{IO_TYPE}] is assigned to the single ended port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use non-differential IO type for the port.

Rule.Name: PortBusIoTypeConsistency
Rule.Description: The bus [{BUS_NAME}] has members with different IO types [{IO_TYPEs}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use a consistent IO Type for all the members in the bus.

Rule.Name: PortBusDirectionConsistency
Rule.Description: The bus [{BUS_NAME}] has members with different port direction.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use the same direction for the bus.

Rule.Name: PortClockAssignment
Rule.Description: The clock port [{PORT_NAME}] is assigned to a non clock dedicated pin [{PIN_NAME}], which might affect the clock performance.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use dedicated clock resources for the port.

Rule.Name: PortPllAssignment
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] connects to a PLL but is not assigned to a PLL dedicated pin, which might affect the clock performance.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a PLL dedicated pin.

Rule.Name: PortInGroupExistence
Rule.ShortDes: Port defined in PORT GROUP existence check
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] defined in port group [{PORT_GROUP}] doesn't exist in the design.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Remove the port.

Rule.Name: PortVrefAssignment
Rule.ShortDes: Port assigned to a vref which is not in the same bank
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] assigned to bank [{BANK_PORT}] is also assigned to VREF [{VREF_NAME}], which is in different bank [{VREF_BANK}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to the same bank [{BANK}] of the VREF [{VREF NAME}].

Rule.Name: PortAssignmentLegalCheck
Rule.ShortDes: Port assigned to pin is illegal
Rule.Description: Based on the current IO attributes settings, port [{PORT_NAME}] cannot be assigned to pin [{PIN_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different pin or change the IO attribute settings of the port.

Rule.Name: IOGroupDriveCheck
Rule.ShortDes: Drive current exceeds limit for IO group
Rule.Description: The average DC current drawn by IOs between GND connections, or between the last GND in an IO bank and the end of an IO bank shall not exceed n * 8mA. Where n is the number of IOs between bank GND connections or between the last GND in a bank and the end of a bank. The violating IO group/region contains port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Rearrange your port assignments such that the Drive limit is exceeded.

Rule.Name: PinExistence
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] is assigned to a nonexistent pin [{PIN_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reassign the port to a valid pin.

Rule.Name: PinStateValue
Rule.Description: The pin [{PIN_NAME}] is {reserved/assigned to }{PORT_NAME} and cannot be assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change the pin's assignment

Rule.Name: PinTypeValue
Rule.Description: The pin [{PIN_NAME}] is not user assignable and cannot be assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}]; for details, please refer to the device datasheet.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change the pin's assignment

Rule.Name: PinDirection
Rule.Description: The [{input/outport}] port [{PORT_NAME}] is assigned to an [{output/input}] dedicated pins [{PIN_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reassign the port to a valid pin.

Rule.Name: PinDifferentialCapability
Rule.Description: The {true-LVDS/differential} port {PORT_NAME} is assigned to a {non-differential/non true-LVDS} pin [{PIN_NAME}] (or illegal differential pair [{NAME}]).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reassign the port to a valid differential pin.

Rule.Name: PinDifferentialPSideExistence
Rule.ShortDes: Differential pin pair positive pin existence check
Rule.Description: The differential port [{PORT_NAME}] cannot be assigned to the pin [{PIN_NAME}] because this pin doesn't have a complementary positive pin.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a valid differential pin pair.

Rule.Name: PinSysConfig
Rule.Description: The state of the assigned pin [{PIN_NAME}] conflicts with the config mode and cannot be assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change pin assignment. Change sysconfig setting.

Rule.Name: PinSysConfigShared
Rule.Description: The state of the assigned pin [{PIN_NAME}] that is to be assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}] coincides with the config mode, which can cause contention on the pin.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change pin assignment. Change sysconfig setting.

Rule.Name: PinIoTypeCapability
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] has IO Type [{IO_TYPE}] assigned, but the IO Type is not supported by the assigned pin [{PIN_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use a pin that support the IO Type.

Rule.Name: PinVrefGroup
Rule.Description: Pins in the VREF group [{GROUP_NAME}] require different VREF values.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Make sure all the pins in the same VREF group require the same VREF value.

Rule.Name: PinProhibit
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] is assigned to a PROHIBIT pin [{PIN_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reassign the port to a different pin.

Rule.Name: PinPllAssignment
Rule.Description: The dedicated PLL pin [{PIN_NAME}] is used for the port [{PORT_NAME}] which doesn't connect to a PLL.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use non PLL dedicated pins.

Rule.Name: PinVrefAvailability
Rule.Description: VREF is required in bank [{BANK}] but there is no VREF pin available in the bank.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Release a {VREF_pin} in bank [{BANK}].

Rule.Name: PinFeatureSupport
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] with [{mode_name}] mode uses [{VCCIO3.3|LVDS|RSDS|HYPT}] that is not supported by the pin [{pin_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a pin that supports the VCCIO/LVDS/RSDS/HYPT feature.

Rule.Name: PinDifferentialPairComplementary
Rule.Description: The differential port [{port_name}] is assigned to the pin [{pin_name}], but this pin's complementary pin [{pin_name}] is taken by the port [{port_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different differential pin pair; or release the complentary pin.

Rule.Name: PinDifferentialPairTrue
Rule.ShortDes: Differential pin pair positive pin check
Rule.Description: The differential port [{port_name}] must be placed on a positive pin of a differential pin pair.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a positive pin of a differential pin pair.

Rule.Name: PinDdrUsageCheck
Rule.Description: The following IDDRX(s) [{port_names}] and ODDRX(s) [{port_names}] can not be placed in the same DQS group.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Check these ports'DDR usage and follow DDR usage model.

Rule.Name: PinDDRSite
Rule.Description: Cannot place PIO comp [{port_name}] on the PIO site [{pin_name}] because this type of DDR cannot be placed at the [{side}] side of ECP3
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign it to a supported side of device (To tell a pin's side from its pad name, PL means left, PR means right, PT means top, PB means bottom).

Rule.Name: PinSysConfig_EFB_USER
Rule.Description: The state of the assigned pin [{PIN_NAME}] conflicts with the config mode and cannot be assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change pin assignment. Change sysconfig setting.

Rule.Name: BankExistence
Rule.Description: Bank [{BANK}] is not available in the target device [{DEVICE_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use a valid bank number.

Rule.Name: BankPinCapacity
Rule.Description: The number of ports [{NUMBER}] assigned to the bank [{BANK_NAME}] exceeds the number [{NUMBER}] of pins available in the bank.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use multiple banks.

Rule.Name: BankDiffPairCapacity
Rule.ShortDes: Bank differential pin pair capacity check
Rule.Description: The number of {true-LVDS/differential} ports [{NUMBER}] assigned to the bank [{BANK_NAME}] exceeds the number of {true-LVDS/differential} pin pairs [{NUMBER]}] available in the bank.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use multiple banks.

Rule.Name: BankVrefCapacity
Rule.Description: The number of different VREF required [{NUMBER}] exceeds the number of VREF capacity [{NUMBER}] supported by the {BANK/DEVICE} [{BANK_NAME/DEVICE_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reduce the number of different VREF required for {BANK/DEVICE} [{BANK_NAME/DEVICE_NAME}].

Rule.Name: BankIoTypeCompatability
Rule.Description: Ports [{PORT_NAMEs}] with incompatible IO types [{IO_TYPEs}] are assigned to the same bank [{BANK_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use multiple banks.

Rule.Name: BankIoTypeCapability
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] has IO Type [{IO_TYPE}] assigned, but the IO Type is not available in the assigned bank [{BANK_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use a bank which supports the IO Type.

Rule.Name: BankVccioValueConsistency
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_value}], VCCIO for [{port_name}] is [{VCCIO_value}] and is incompatible with other ports that use VCCIO [{VCCIO_value}] (refer to port [{port_name}]).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank. {suggestions}

Rule.Name: BankVttValueConsistency
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_value}], VTT for [{bank_port}] is [{VTT_value}] and is incompatible with other ports that use VTT [{VTT_value}] (refer to port [{port_name}]).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank.

Rule.Name: BankVrefLoadConsistency
Rule.ShortDes: Bank VREF load IO_TYPE consistency check
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_value}], VREF for [{port_name}] is different from the other two VREFs for ports [{port_name}] and [{port_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank.

Rule.Name: BankVrefLoad1DriverMatch
Rule.ShortDes: Bank VREF1 load driver consistency check
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] in the bank [{bank_value}] uses VREF1_LOAD, but there is no VREF1_DRIVER in that bank.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Add VREF1_DRIVER to the bank.

Rule.Name: BankVrefLoad2DriverMatch
Rule.ShortDes: Bank VREF2 load driver consistency check
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] in the bank [{bank_value}] uses VREF2_LOAD, but there is no VREF2_DRIVER in that bank.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank.

Rule.Name: BankVcmtConsistency
Rule.ShortDes: Bank VCMT usage and IO_TYPE consistency check
Rule.Description: The ports [{port_name}] and [{port_name}] in the bank [{bank_value}] use VCMTs but their IO_TYPEs [{IO_TYPE_value}] and [{IO_TYPE_value}] are different.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank; Or modify IO_TYPE for one of the ports.

Rule.Name: BankDifferentialLimit
Rule.Description: HYPT buffer is used together with LVDS/RSDS in the same bank. The port [{port_name}] is in conflict with other ports in the bank [{bank_value}] (refer to port [{port_name}]).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank.

Rule.Name: BankVttDdrIIVcmtExclusive
Rule.Description: VCMT buffer is used together with VTT/DDR_II in the same bank. The port [{port_name}] is in conflict with other ports in bank [{bank_value}] (refer to port [{port_name}]).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different bank.

Rule.Name: BankUniqueLVDS
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_number}], the port [{port_name}] has its own LVDS signal [{signal_name}] which is different from the bank's LVDS signal [{signal_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a bank with the same LVDS signal.

Rule.Name: BankUniquePG
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_number}], the port [{port_name}] has its own PG signal [{signal_name}] which is different from the bank's PG signal [{signal_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a bank with same PG signal.

Rule.Name: BankUniqueINRD
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_number}], the port [{port_name}] has its own INRD signal [{signal_name}] which is different from the bank's INRD signal [{signal_name}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a bank with the same INRD signal.

Rule.Name: ConfigBankIOVoltageMismatch
Rule.Description: Cannot assign [{PORT_NAME}] to [{IO_TYPE}] in bank [{BANK}] because [{CONFIG_KEY}] is set to [{CONFIG_ON_VALUE}] and CONFIG_IOVOLTAGE do not match the I/O voltage of the [{PORT_NAME}] in bank [{BANK}]
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Match CONFIG_IOVOLTAGE to the an acceptable IO_TYPE for the port.

Rule.Name: DiffdriveBankMismatch
Rule.Description: In the bank [{bank_value}], differential outputs [{port_name1}] and [{port_name2}] have {incompatible IO_TYPE values/different DIFFDRIVE values}{DRIVE1}{}{DRIVE2}.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign one port to a different bank, or change them to compatible IO_TYPEs.

Rule.Name: BankVccioValueCompatibility
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] with Bank VCCIO requirement [{VCCIO_value}] cannot be assigned to Bank [{bank_value}] because it is incompatible with the Bank's VCCIO [{VCCIO_value}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a compatible bank. Change the Bank VCCIO value to be compatible with the port.

Rule.Name: ConfigBankVccioValueCompatibility
Rule.ShortDes: Config Bank VCCIO value compatibility check
Rule.Description: In bank 8, the Bank VCCIO cannot be set to [{VCCIO_value}] because this Bank is used during configuration and the CONFIG_IOVOLTAGE is already set to [{CONFIG_ON_VALUE}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Change the CONFIG_IOVOLTAGE value to be compatible with the Bank VCCIO value. Change the Bank VCCIO value to be compatible with the CONFIG_IOVOLTAGE value.

Rule.Name: DeviceVrefCapacity
Rule.Description: The number of VREF required [{NUMBER}] exceeds the number of VREF pins [{NUMBER}] available in the device [{DEVICE_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Use large devices with more VREF pins.

Rule.Name: DeviceVccioCapacity
Rule.Description: The number of VCCIO or bank required exceeds the total number of banks available [{BANK_NUMBER}] based on the current assignment.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Reduce number of IO Types. Use compatible IO types. Change to a large device with more banks.

Rule.Name: SysConfigCheck
Rule.Description: All configuration modes/options of the design have been disabled.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Enabled the desire device configuration method.

Rule.Name: IOBUFAttributeNameValidation
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] has invalid IOBUF attribute name [{KEY_NAME}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Check the string [{KEY_NAME}] for typos, or use a valid attribute name.

Rule.Name: IOBUFAttributeValueValidation
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] has some invalid IOBUF attribute values: [{KEY: VALUE}].
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Check the assignments for those attribute and use valid values.

Rule.Name: IOBUFLegalCombinationTableValidation
Rule.Description: The port [{PORT_NAME}] has invalid combination of the IOBUF settings according to the device I/O specifications.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Check the IOBUF setting and correct the errors.

Rule.Name: PicCompatibleX24AilTri
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] at pad [{A|B|C|D}] and the port [{port_name}] at pad [{A|B|C|D}] are competing for DDR resources (x2,x4,AIL or tri-state), they cannot be shared in one PIC.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different PIC (A group of PIO pins consists of adjacent A/B/C/D pads).

Rule.Name: PicCompatibleOutput
Rule.ShortDes: PIC IOLOGIC output and SHX4/DDR4 compatible check
Rule.Description: The port [{port_name}] at pad [{A|B|C|D}] cannot be used as output (or input) when the [{port_name}] at pad [{A|B|C|D}] is in SHX4/DDRX4 mode (or using AIL).
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the port to a different PIC (A group of PIO pins consists of adjacent A/B/C/D pads).

Rule.Name: VrefGroupPinAssignment
Rule.Description: VREF GROUP [{GROUP_NAME}] is assigned to pin [{PIN_NAME}], which is {already assigned to port/not a vref pin}{PORT_NAME}{}.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the group to a valid VREF pin, and make sure the pin is not already assigned.

Rule.Name: VrefGroupExistence
Rule.Description: VREFGROUP [{GROUP_NAME}] assigned to the port [{PORT_NAME}] is not defined.
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: Assign the group to a valid VREF pin, and ensure the VREF pin is not already assigned.

Rule.Name: OnDemandPIODRC
Rule.Description: OnDemandPIODRC
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: OnDemandPIODRC

Rule.Name: EnableRealTimePIODRC
Rule.Description: EnableRealTimePIODRC
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: EnableRealTimePIODRC

Rule.Name: EnableOnDemandPIODRC
Rule.Description: EnableOnDemandPIODRC
Rule.PossibleSuggestedActions: EnableOnDemandPIODRC
